newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks mostly higher in OTC trade.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks mostly higher in OTC trade.

text.p: Following is the closing report for Croatia's over-the-counter share market in Varazdin and its outpost Osijek for Monday, October 7.
* Eight of 12 active issues rose, two were flat and two traded for the first time.
* 10-stock VIN index up 4.14 percent to a new high of 8,081 points.
* Most actively traded textile firm Varteks flat at 20 marks a share on volume of 2,287 units.
* Biggest gainer, hotelier Jadran Crikvenica, rose 66.67 percent to 250 marks with 40 shares sold. It was followed by:
- Riviera, up 34.62 percent to 70 marks on volume of 307,
- Confectioner Kras, up 25.0 percent to 200 marks with 58 shares sold,
- Istraturist, rising 14.04 percent to 65 marks on volume of 1,798 units. In a separate deal, 114 paid and 286 unpaid shares were sold for 9,500 marks.
- Arenaturist, rose 10.0 percent to 55 marks with 417 units traded,
- Cable maker Elka, up 9.09 percent to 60 marks on volume of 485 and hotelier Laguna, also up 9.09 percent to 300 marks on volume of 78 shares,
- Adriatic pipeline operator Janaf, added 4.17 percent to 625 marks with 99 shares sold.
* Food processor Podravka, selling 917 shares, unchanged at 75 marks. A package of 717 unpaid shares went at 15 marks each.
* In a first transaction on the OTC market:
- Hotelier Anita sold 23 shares at 400 marks each

- Tour operator Atlas sold 90 shares at 50 marks. It traded at 150 kuna (42 marks) a share last week on the semi-regulated segment of Zagreb's bourse. -- Kolumbina Bencevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
